member.name: PROCESSOR_RELATIONSHIP
member.summary: Represents information about affinity within a processor group. This structure is used with the function.

summary.para: If the Relationship member of the structure is RelationProcessorCore, this member is LTP_PC_SMT if the core has more than one logical processor, or 0 if the core has one logical processor.
If the Relationship member of the structure is RelationProcessorPackage, this member is always 0.

If the Relationship member of the structure is RelationProcessorCore, EfficiencyClass specifies the intrinsic tradeoff between performance and power for the applicable core. A core with a higher value for the efficiency class has intrinsically greater performance and less efficiency than a core with a lower value for the efficiency class. EfficiencyClass is only nonzero on systems with a heterogeneous set of cores.
If the Relationship member of the structure is RelationProcessorPackage, EfficiencyClass is always 0.
The minimum operating system version that supports this member is Windows 10.

member.name: PROCESSOR_RELATIONSHIP.GroupCount
member.summary: This member specifies the number of entries in the GroupMask array. For more information, see Remarks.

member.name: PROCESSOR_RELATIONSHIP.GroupMask
member.summary: An array of structures. The GroupCount member specifies the number of structures in the array. Each structure in the array specifies a group number and processor affinity within the group.
